bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, December 8, 1885

div1.p: Reed requests and is granted a one-month extension to the leave of absence he was granted on November 18, 1885.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, December 8, 1885
div1.p:
Reed Walter
Captain & Asst. Surgeon U.S.A.
S.O. 293 Par. 2. Dec. 22, 85.
Applic. for one month extension
of the leave of absence granted
him by S.O.# 115 U.S. Headqrs.
Department of the Platte.

ADJUTANT GENL'S OFFICE,
RECEIVED
DEC 14 1885
A.C.

1st ENDORSEMENT.
Headquarters Division of the Mo.
Chicago, December 11, 1885

Respectfully forwarded to
the Adjutant General of
the Army, approved, for
the decision of the Secretary
of War, under A.R. 83.

Respectfully referred, for
remark, to the Surgeon
General, U.S. Army.

By order of the
Secretary of War.

Respectfully returned
to the Adjutant General
of the Army, ap-
proved and recom-
mended.

This app'n is for
1 mo's extension of a
1 mo's leave granted by
Dept. Comdr., who gave
permission to apply for
the extension.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, December 8, 1885
div1.opener:
No. 55 Freemason St.
Norfolk, Virginia,
December 8th 1885.
To the
Adjutant General,
Division of the Missouri,
Chicago, Ill.,
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to respectfully
request that the leave of absence
granted me per S.O. No. 115, C.S. Head-
quarters Department of the Platte, Omaha,
Nebraska, November 18th 1885, may be
extended for the period of one month.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully,
Yours obt. Servant, Walter Reed, Asst. Surgeon,
U.S.A. Army.
